intro: Diosma filipetala, commonly known as the Philippine diosma, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Solanaceae, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in forest understories and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are usually ovate to lanceolate, and it produces berries that contain the seeds. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
